message:
8 cores for a mobile device!! da tahreeg wallahi.
da fe nas lessa Core2Due we nas lessa Pentium4 :D
story: Mohammed El Sayed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Samsung Announces 8-Core Exynos 5 Octa Mobile Processor, Could Power The Galaxy S4 | Redmond Pie
caption: redmondpie.com
description: If you've been using smartphones consistently over the past five or so years, you'll doubtlessly have noticed that, through generations, they have become considerably faster, and this is due largely to the increase in processing power. Samsung has led the way in terms of delivering stronger, more co...

data.message: I am still running Core2Due :D and I am running Windows 8 on it
Mohammed Hossam omal law edoolak el processor da hate3mel eeh? :D

it's really incredible how the mobile industry is incorporating technologies that the desktop side was crawling for them for years in just few months.
for example, this 8 core processor was a out of reach for the desktop computers for years. but now, it could be the one to power a mobile phone in your pocket with much much increased power efficiency comparing to it's desktop version.
At the end of the day all this hardware is just for marketing, multiple core ARM processors are still nothing compared to multiple core x32 processors.

till today, the rumors around the upcoming Galaxy S4 are:
1- a 5.0 inches screen with full HD resolution (1920 x 1080).
2- the screen will have 441 ppi pixel density (this is by far more than the Apple's Retina display)
3- 2 GB ram.
4- 14MB camera that shoots 1080@30 FPS videos

5- 3awzeen eeh tani, begad 7aram elli bye7sal dah :D
Mohammed Hossam: this is correct, but don't forget that ARM processors are not intended to compete with x32 processors. so for their purpose, they are extremely powerful and energy-efficient.
the same is for all SOCs out there.
